name: Spicy Edamame
description: Snack on these fiery and spicy edamame sautéed with chili paste, garlic, and miso. It's intensely delicious. You won't be able to stop eating these!

video.name: Spicy Edamame #shorts
video.description:
Snack on these fiery and spicy edamame sautéed with chili paste, garlic, and miso. It’s intensely delicious. You won’t be able to stop eating these!

RECIPE: https://www.justonecookbook.com/spicy-edamame/

For Cooking the Edamame Pods

10-14 oz edamame (in pods; I use frozen edamame)
1 QT water (1 QT = 4 cups)
1 Tbsp kosher salt (Diamond Crystal; use half for table salt) (edamame pods are thick; therefore, we need to salt the cooking water to give the soybeans a subtle base flavor; the spicy and salty flavors are mostly on the pods)

For the Spicy Sauce

1 Tbsp neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, rice bran, canola, etc.)
2 cloves garlic (minced)
1 Tbsp chili paste (Sambal Oelek)
1 tsp miso
2 Tbsp soy sauce
2 Tbsp mirin

recipeIngredient: 10–14 oz edamame ((in pods; I use frozen edamame))

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 QT water to a pot and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, add 1 Tbsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 QT water to a pot and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, add 1 Tbsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 10–14 oz edamame (frozen) pods and cook, stirring once in a while, for 4–5 minutes, or until the soybeans are an al dente consistency. (Read the package instructions carefully and check if the soybeans are raw or cooked. Frozen edamame imported from Japan are always precooked, so you only need to boil them for 1 minute to reheat).
recipeInstructions.name: Add 10–14 oz edamame (frozen) pods and cook, stirring once in a while, for 4–5 minutes, or until the soybeans are an al dente consistency. (Read the package instructions carefully and check if the soybeans are raw or cooked. Frozen edamame imported from Japan are always precooked, so you only need to boil them for 1 minute to reheat).

recipeInstructions.text: If you see foam forming on the surface of the water, remove it with a fine-mesh skimmer because we do not rinse the pods after cooking. When the edamame are done cooking, drain in a colander. DO NOT RINSE, or the edamame will lose their salted flavor. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: If you see foam forming on the surface of the water, remove it with a fine-mesh skimmer because we do not rinse the pods after cooking. When the edamame are done cooking, drain in a colander. DO NOT RINSE, or the edamame will lose their salted flavor. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large frying pan over medium-low to medium heat. When the pan is warm, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil and 2 cloves garlic (minced) and sauté until fragrant. Don‘t burn the garlic.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large frying pan over medium-low to medium heat. When the pan is warm, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil and 2 cloves garlic (minced) and sauté until fragrant. Don‘t burn the garlic.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 Tbsp Sambal Oelek Chili Paste and 1 tsp miso and stir until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 Tbsp Sambal Oelek Chili Paste and 1 tsp miso and stir until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 Tbsp soy sauce and 2 Tbsp mirin and cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce is thickened a little bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2 Tbsp soy sauce and 2 Tbsp mirin and cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce is thickened a little bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked edamame pods to the pan and toss to coat them with the sauce. Transfer to a plate and serve warm or at room temperature. To eat, remove the soybeans from their inedible pods and enjoy.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked edamame pods to the pan and toss to coat them with the sauce. Transfer to a plate and serve warm or at room temperature. To eat, remove the soybeans from their inedible pods and enjoy.

itemListElement.text: Keep the leftovers in the refrigerator and reheat to warm or bring it to room temperature before serving.
itemListElement.name: Keep the leftovers in the refrigerator and reheat to warm or bring it to room temperature before serving.

review.reviewBody:
Hi Nami.
It is the best seasoned edamame I have ever tried.
Thank you for sharing your drlicious recipes.

We've made this recipe 3 times in the last week. Our friends can't get enough of it! We did make it a little less spicy for some friends and they were all begging for the recipe. They couldn't believe how easy it is to make and how delicious it is!
This was a delicious way to have edamame! We loved the taste and will definitely be making this again!

I LOVE edamame. It has been a staple for years in my home. I never cut the tips and will try doing that. I use it so many ways and even use the shelled edamame. As a warm side dish. The spicy recipe is calling me!!
